title: Technical Director
description: Technical Director of ART where I have been involved in the design, development and production of telemetry systems for Formula 1 cars (partner of MAGNETI MARELLI). The main customers are Ferrari and Toyota. Key projects • Lap Trigger, a system capable to detect, by an RF signal, when the F1 car is passing in front of the trigger and then to measure the time elapsed between subsequent triggers. • High band telemetry exploiting OFDM technology.

title: Hardware and Software Developments Manager
description: Responsible for the HW/SW Department of UNI.COM SpA, Telit Group, a company involved in the design and development of set top boxes for European digital television (DVB) and internet TV, wireless application, based on GSM and DECT, and Power Line Communications for home networking. Coordinator of a team of twenty engineers. Project Manager for the design of a multimedia gateway capable of delivering multimedia information, coming from satellite data-link, LMDS/MMDS link, optical fiber or trough MATV distribution network. Key projects • DVB-T IRD based on STMicroelectronics chipset platform (ST55xx) • Internet Set Top Box based on National SC1200 chipset • Fixed cellular for GSM communication

title: Hardware and DSP Design Manager
description: Project Manager for the design, development, integration and testing of systems for digital broadcasting modulation according to DVB-T, ATSC and DAB waveforms (COFDM and 8VSB). The digital processing has been implemented using FPGA, DSP (ADSP2181, ADSP21060) and off-the-shelf components. The DVB-T system modulator has been designed in cooperation with BBC Research and Development (Mr. Chris Clark) in a time frame of two years. The ATSC modulator has been integrated and tested for six months at Zenith Corp. Laboratory of Chicago (Mr. Gary Sgrignoli). Research Manager for studies and prototypes development of a linear pre-equalization and an adaptive linearization of high power amplifier AM/AM and AM/PM characteristics. Key projects • DAB system modulator based on three ADSP2181 for channel encoding and one ADS21060 for IFFT as requested by the OFDM modulation. • DVB-T and ATSC system modulators using an array of FPGAs to implement all necessary data processing blocks as requested by the Standards. • Single Frequency Adapter for DVB-T networks • Pre-equalizer filter for 8VSB transmission to counteract linear distortion due to antenna reflections and impairments of analog filtering • RF High Power Amplifier pre-corrector using base-band processing (look-up-table algorithm)
name: Graziano Lubello Lincenti

title: Digital Signal Processing Designer
description: ALCATEL TELETTRA Military Telecommunications Laboratory, Chieti DSP Development Designer After my thesis work, I joined DSP Research Laboratory developing skills in Digital Signal Processing, Adaptive Equalization and ASIC Design. Key projects • Software modem for HF communications according to Nato STANAG 4285 waveforms (PSK) (based on three Motorola DSP56002) • Matlab simulation of a time varying HF channel • Matlab and C implementation of algorithms for adaptive equalization (LMS, RLS, ZF, SVD, DFE, FTF) • Designer of an ASIC for the physical layer of military digital telephone, (including adaptive echo cancellation for two wires transmission). • Software FSK modem based on DSP56002
name: Graziano Lubello Lincenti

title: Software Manager
description: The software manager responsibilities included analyzing and providing detailed recommendations on testing dealing with system and operational architectures; coordinate with user community representatives throughout all phases of testing and development including requirements definition, clarification, prioritization, and alternatives; and apply emerging doctrine and tactics to testing system design while assessing the impact of programmatic and technical options on stated user requirements. Developed Information Assurance documentation detailing how the Biometrics Identification System for Access (BISA) addresses the protection of the integrity, availability, authenticity, non-repudiation and confidentiality of user data. The documentation includes the organizations defense in-depth strategy for assuring information and managing risks related to the use, processing, storage, and transmission of information or data and the systems and processes used for those purposes. Responsible for developing physical, technical and administrative controls to accomplish the organizations Information Assurance goals for protecting data in transit and data at rest. Responsible for creating the System Security Plan, Continuity of Operation Documentation, Hardware and Software Lists, Personnel and Technical Controls, and Standard Operating Procedures. Used software tools to scan systems for vulnerabilities and provided reports on all systems after making the appropriate modifications to correct the vulnerabilities. Worked with the certifying agency to ensure that DODI 8510.01 DoD Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation Process (DIACAP); DODI 8500.2 Information Assurance Implementation and Federal Information Security Act of 2002 (FISMA) guidelines were implemented securing a three year authority to Operate. Participated in yearly documentation reviews and table top exercises.

title: System Analyst IV
description: As a System Analyst IV my primary responsibilities included the development of test plans and testing information systems for Department of Defense including the Biometric Information System for Access (BISA) ,the Biometric Automated Toolset (BAT) and the Handheld Interagency Identity Detection Equipment (HIIDE) . Supported the operational testing of the various components of the BISA system including the Card Management System, the verification portal and handle device, the live scan enrolment hardware and software and ancillary equipment. Identified issues with both hardware and software components of BISA and developed detailed Problem Change Requests. Provided logistical support for the BISA fielding team during system fielding and provided ongoing support to the fielding team during installation of the BISA Equipment. Provided training to the BISA System Administrators Support the development of test plans and testing of Commercial of the Shelf biometrics products. Provided biometric and BISA system briefings and demonstrations to stakeholders and system users.
name: Herb Ohliger

groups.name: Biometric Consortium - AFCEA Global Identity Summit

title: System Analyst IV
description: As a System Analyst IV my primary responsibilities included the development of test plans and testing information systems for Department of Defense including the Biometric Information System for Access (BISA) and the Biometric Automated Toolset (BAT). Deployed to Iraq to support the operational testing of the various components of the BISA system including the Card Management System, the verification portal and handle device, the live scan enrolment hardware and software and ancillary equipment. Identified issues with both hardware and software components of BISA and developed detailed Problem Change Requests. Prepared logistical support for the BISA fielding team prior to arrival and during fielding. Provided ongoing support to the fielding team during installation of the BISA Equipment. Provided training to the BISA System Administrators. Served on the Air Force PICS source selection board. Support the development of test plans and testing of Commercial of the Shelf biometrics products.

title: Information Assurance System Specialist
description: As an Information Assurance System Specialist my primary responsibilities included providing customer support in solving all phases of complex information assurance-related technical problems; reviewing and recommending information assurance solutions to customer problems based on an understanding of products/systems test results: conducting systems security analysis and implementation, system engineering, electrical design, design assurance, testing, software engineering, program design, configuration management, integration and testing of information assurance products and techniques. Solutions are based on a firm understanding of government/industry policy, practices, procedures, customer requirements, and emerging security technologies and future trends in support of information system and network security and Insures that information assurance solutions are fully compatible with or engineered into the customer’s network design. Provides work direction and guidance to other personnel; ensures accuracy of the work of other personnel, operates under deadlines and able to work on multiple tasks. Specific responsibilities include the development of the Common Access Card Test Execution Plan, Test Plan, Test Methodology, Test Procedures and a Test Campaign Package. Responsible for the setup of the Department of Defense Biometrics Fusion Center Common Access Card Lab. Other responsibilities include Support of Common Access Card Biometric Working Group, supporting the vendors awarded the Technology Demonstration contract, coordination and support of the seven-offsite testing partners. Coordinated the tasking of the members of the Test and Evaluation Team, review vendor biweekly status reports, participated in the vendor biweekly reviews. Directed daily internal status meetings.
name: Herb Ohliger

groups.name: Biometric Consortium - AFCEA Global Identity Summit

title: Information Assurance System Specialist / Information Center Consultant
description: Information Assurance System Specialist my responsibilities included providing customer support in solving all phases of complex information assurance-related technical problems; reviewing and recommending information assurance solutions to customer problems based on an understanding of products/systems test results: conducting systems security analysis and implementation, system engineering, electrical design, design assurance, testing, software engineering, program design, configuration management, integration and testing of information assurance products and techniques. Solutions are based on a firm understanding of government/industry policy, practices, procedures, customer requirements, and emerging security technologies and future trends in support of information system and network security and Insures that information assurance solutions are fully compatible with or engineered into the customer’s network design. Provides work direction and guidance to other personnel and operates under deadlines and able to work on multiple tasks. Information Center Consultant my responsibilities included testing and evaluating biometric devices used for physical and computer system access. During the test and evaluation process each product is evaluated from the perspective of our customer’s information assurance needs. Based on the customers needs recommendations concerning the implementation of information assurance products and techniques are fully compatible with the customer’s network design. During the test and evaluation process each product is evaluating to include a systems security analysis, implementation and user impact documentation, software design, software implementation, network integration, configuration management and hardware design. after test completion a detailed report is delivered to the customer with recommendations regarding the products ability to provide solutions for customers information assurance related problems.

title: Senior System Engineer
description: Technical Sales Support / System Integration / Operating System Upgrades As a Senior System Engineer I worked with sales staff, customers and users to solve their business problems through use of technology implementation including hardware, software and remote communications. I routinely used IBM tools to analyze the performance of customer hardware and software and recommend solutions based on the analysis of the performance reports. I was responsible for the implementation of IBM AS/400 Systems and integrated windows servers. As part of the installation process I was responsible for training users on both the hardware and the software. When implementing a new or upgraded system I was responsible for reviewing, recommending and implementing information assurance solutions. I was responsible for directing and guiding other personnel involved in each project as well as ensuring the accuracy and completeness of their work meeting all project dead lines. As part of supporting the sales staff I was responsible for evaluating new hardware and software products and recommending and implementing the products when appropriate to provide solutions to our customers. I was responsible for maintaining multiple customer’s operating systems at current levels as well as providing hardware and software troubleshooting.
name: Herb Ohliger

groups.name: Biometric Consortium - AFCEA Global Identity Summit

title: Senior System Engineer
description: Software Development / Technical Sales / Training / Data and software conversion and Migration Responsibilities included analyzing and designing customer educational courses in IBM AS/400 operations, IBM AS/400 Advanced Operations, RPG Programming, Subfile Programming, Command Language Programming and AS/400 DDS. Analyzed and designed courses based on customer requirements, coordinated employee schedules, taught classes and evaluated student’s progress. Responsible for working with customers and their end users to evaluate, document, analyze, design and test application software. This process included interviewing users to develop a list of user requirements, design and develop and test the new application in accordance with existing testing methodology. Responsible for cross platform data conversions, CISC to RISC migrations, IBM System 34, System 36 and System 38 software and data migrations to the IBM AS/400 platform, software and data testing post migration, AS/400 installations, site layout, customer training, AS/400 Operating System Release Upgrades, PTF installations, technical support to marketing staff, and performance evaluations of AS/400 computer hardware and software. Responsible for providing time estimates to customers and regularly reviewing the status of each project until completion. Responsible for directing and guiding other personnel involved in each project as well as ensuring the accuracy and completeness of their work meeting all project dead lines. Responsible for evaluating the customers existing hardware and software to make recommendations regarding the implementation of new hardware and software to provide a technological solution to solve the customer’s end user problems. Most of the customers that we serviced did not have Information Technology staff members which allowed me the opportunity to manage multiple projects simultaneously at different sites as well as being able to trouble shoot both hardware and software problems.
name: Herb Ohliger

groups.name: Biometric Consortium - AFCEA Global Identity Summit
iSchool at Pitt (School of Information Sciences)

title: Senior System Engineer
description: Software Developer / System Integrator / Technical Sales / Training / Data and Software Conversion and Migration / Operating System Upgrades Responsibilities included working with customers’ end users to analyze user requirements to design custom databases and software applications and develop test data and test the software applications in accordance with existing company testing methodologies. Responsible for scheduling and estimating project time in the following areas, implementing customer hardware upgrades, PTF installations, Operating System upgrades and software projects. Performed Cross Platform Data Conversions, System 34, System 36 and System 38 to AS/400 migrations. Responsible for directing and guiding other personnel involved in each project as well as ensuring the accuracy and completeness of their work meeting all project dead lines. Provided technical support to sales staff and was responsible for analyzing customer hardware and software needs and providing physical site layout and end user training after installation of IBM AS/400s, personal computers and various application software packages. Responsible for the management of several projects where I designed and implemented standard testing procedures. The testing procedures included the development of test data, procedures for testing applications, the documentation of testing results, analyzing the test results and making recommendations based on the analysis. Performed routine hardware and software performance evaluations on customer equipment to provide quality assurance of user systems. Developed and taught courses to CL, DDS and Basic AS/400 Operations to our in-house system consultants. As part of our customer service package for new hardware or software sales I would analysis and document the organizations current security as well as provide technical support for the implementation of security policies and procedures based on user requirements analysis.
name: Herb Ohliger

title: Software Developer and Security Officer
description: Responsibilities included analyzing, documenting, design, programming, enhancing and maintaining agency programs, screens and files. Designed and coded the agency’s software release/change management system, which entails managing source and object code, both new and enhanced. Additional responsibilities included maintaining security access to libraries and files and testing all software prior to implementation and release. I was also responsible for meeting with users, documenting and analyzing user requirements, working with programming staff to develop software, test the software, and implement the software. After implementation of the software I would train the end users on the new or changed applications. I was responsible for solving the companies problem of running short on memory and hard disk space. I accomplished this task by evaluating several existing software products I selected and installed a product called Hawkeye. Hawkeye was used in the information center to locate redundant files and unused application programs. After analyzing the reports I then removed the unused or redundant programs and files freeing thirty percent of the system. I was also charged with maintain security on the agency’s data files. I achieved this by implementing security in the operating system, on users and at the application design level.
name: Herb Ohliger

title: Kitchen Help
description: Restaurant duties included operation and maintenance of food service equipment and stocking. Progressed to position of supervisor where increased responsibilities included purchasing, pricing, and expediting and inventory control. The Restaurant Inventory Control Lead is responsible for coordinating with internal as well as external sources of the organization. Responsibilities include” • Meet with Sales Representatives and main suppliers • Report any discrepancies/overbids or quality issues of food/non-food items Maintain a working knowledge of all vendor products/services • Receive deliveries/put away product/ensure proper rotation of product • Check for freshness, damaged, spoiled or broken goods • Ensure proper rotation of items is being followed • Verify invoices with bids post amounts to purchase tracker • Ensure invoices are coded to proper department and account • Meet with Chef to review weeks activity of cost of goods and purchases • Take physical inventory count of food and non-food items Food Service Preparation and Expediting Responsibilities include” • Clean work areas, equipment, utensils, dishes, pots, floors, and silverware. • Store food in designated containers and storage areas to prevent spoilage. • Prepare a variety of foods according to customers' orders or supervisors' instructions, following approved procedures. • Package take-out foods and/or serve food to customers. • Portion and wrap the food, or place it directly on plates for service to patrons. • Place food trays over food warmers for immediate service, or store them in refrigerated storage cabinets • Support Buffet Service • Receive order from dining room staff, coordinate orders with cook staff and send prepared orders to dining room
name: Herb Ohliger

title: Guard (Wackenhut)
description: Responsible for patrolling the premises of customers or buildings to detect suspicious activity, assist tenants, and ensure the safety of occupants. Maintain safe and secure environment for customers and employees by patrolling and monitoring premises and personnel. Job Duties: • Secures premises and personnel by patrolling property; monitoring surveillance equipment; inspecting buildings, equipment, and access points; permitting entry. • Identify visitors and ask for appropriate documents. Stop suspicious people and ask for identification. • Obtains help by sounding alarms. • Prevents losses and damage by reporting irregularities; informing violators of policy and procedures; restraining trespassers. • Controls traffic by directing drivers. • Completes reports by recording observations, information, occurrences, and surveillance activities; interviewing witnesses; obtaining signatures. • Maintains environment by monitoring and setting building and equipment controls. • Maintains organization's stability and reputation by complying with legal requirements. • Ensures operation of equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer's instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs; evaluating new equipment and techniques. • Inspect windows and doors to ensure locks are in place and working. • Use walkie-talkies and cell phones to stay in contact with security personnel. • Respond to alarms and calls of distress. Call for aid if necessary. • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
